subject: Learning
title: The Myth of Effortless Mastery
description: A 60-second lesson on The Myth of Effortless Mastery.

hook.text: A chess grandmaster makes a brilliant move in two seconds. It looks effortless. It wasn't.

buildup.text: Behind every 'instant' expert decision are thousands of hours of deliberate, effortful practice.

discovery.text: Expertise compresses effort into automaticity. The struggle happened in practice, not in performance.

twist.text: When we see only the performance, we assume talent. We miss the invisible years of grind.

climax.text: This visibility gap discourages beginners who compare their struggle to an expert's polish.

punchline.text: Mastery looks effortless because the effort happened earlier.

quiz.question: Why does expertise appear effortless?
options: Practice compresses effort into automaticity over time
Experts are born with the ability
They skip the learning process entirely
